column4: I need help booting my flash drive. I'm trying to boot Pear Linux and everytime I select my flash drive to boot it takes me to GRUB
Yeah I just used MATE as well and switched
You know how to get to the outside of the boot menu?
BIOS?
YOU can set the usb boot from the bios and there is a key press to get you to a menu outside of the bios.
how do I do that?
Mine is f12 like you would going to the bios, yours may be different.
I've tried going to BIOS and making the flash drive boot first and it doesn't work. I was able to boot from my flash drive earlier today with no problems.
And on the computer it says flash drive is part of the HDD group
Some computers use f12 some other keys you can look on the web for the boot from menu for your setup, or post it here if you don't find it and we can try.
I've tried before. It's an HP pavilion a6109n
I think the HP is esc
yeah that's the boot menu
Then I select my flash drive from the boot menu and it takes me to GRUB
How did you load the usb, and did you do a md5sum on the ISO?
no. I used unetbootin to but the iso onto it
put*
what do you mean by redo the liveUSB
I used the mac version of unetbootin to do it
and I already tried doing it again
k
brb
The only thing I would say here as well is that that OS does not have as wide and large amount of support as ubuntu, this channel would not help you for one.
